column1: Napoléon Bonaparte (French: Napoleone di Buonaparte; 15 August 1769 – 5 May 1821) was a French military and political leader who rose to prominence during the French Revolution and led several successful campaigns during the Revolutionary Wars. As Napoleon I
column2: he was Emperor of the French from 1804 until 1814
column3: and again in 1815. Napoleon dominated European and global affairs for more than a decade while leading France against a series of coalitions in the Napoleonic Wars. He won most of these wars and the vast majority of his battles
column4: building a large empire that ruled over continental Europe before its final collapse in 1815. One of the greatest commanders in history
column5: his wars and campaigns are studied at military schools worldwide. He also remains one of the most celebrated and controversial political figures in human history.
